title.value: NollySenti: Leveraging Transfer Learning and Machine Translation for Nigerian Movie Sentiment Classification
title.justification: The title is extracted directly from the paper and accurately represents the scope of the research.
title.quote: NollySenti: Leveraging Transfer Learning and Machine Translation for Nigerian Movie Sentiment Classification

extractions.description: This paper presents NollySenti, a new sentiment classification dataset based on Nollywood movie reviews for five widely spoken languages in Nigeria: English, Hausa, Igbo, Nigerian-Pidgin, and Yorùbá. The research explores the effectiveness of transfer learning and machine translation for cross-domain and cross-lingual sentiment classification in low-resource languages.

type.justification: The paper provides empirical evaluations using classical machine learning methods and pre-trained language models, along with transfer learning and machine translation techniques.
type.quote: We provide an extensive empirical evaluation using classical machine learning methods and pre-trained language models.

name.justification: The research focuses on creating and evaluating the NollySenti dataset for sentiment analysis, which falls under the domain of Natural Language Processing (NLP).

name.justification: The paper evaluates cross-lingual adaptation from English language to other Nigerian languages.
name.quote: Leveraging transfer learning, we compare the performance of cross-domain adaptation from Twitter domain, and cross-lingual adaptation from English language.

name.justification: Transfer learning techniques are used to compare the performance of cross-domain adaptation from Twitter and cross-lingual adaptation from English.

name.justification: The paper leverages machine translation from English to other Nigerian languages to improve sentiment classification performance.
name.quote: To further mitigate the domain difference, we leverage machine translation (MT) from English to other Nigerian languages.
